homepage:
name: Mealie
category: My Apps
icon: https://github.com/mealie-recipes/mealie/raw/main/docs/docs/assets/img/home_screenshot.png
url: https://demo.mealie.io
docs:
# About

Mealie is a self-hosted recipe manager, meal planner, and shopping list application with a REST API backend and a reactive frontend built in Vue. It offers features such as recipe imports, meal planning, and shopping list management. Mealie also provides an API for interactions from third-party applications.

![Mealie Screenshot](https://github.com/mealie-recipes/mealie/raw/main/docs/docs/assets/img/home_screenshot.png)

## Prerequisites

- Docker
- Docker Compose

## Installation

1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/mealie-recipes/mealie.git
   cd mealie
   ```

2. Set up the environment variables:
   - `DB_ENGINE`: The database engine to use (e.g., `sqlite`, `postgres`)
   - `DB_HOST`: The database host
   - `DB_PORT`: The database port
   - `DB_USER`: The database user
   - `DB_PASSWORD`: The database password
   - `DB_NAME`: The database name

3. Start the application using Docker Compose:
   ```bash
   docker-compose up -d
   ```

## Configuration

- Access the application at `http://localhost:9925`.
- Configure the application settings via the UI or by editing the `config.yml` file located in `${DATA_ROOT}/mealie/config`.

## Tips

- Join the [Discord community](https://discord.gg/QuStdQGSGK) for support and discussions.
- Explore the [documentation](https://docs.mealie.io/) for detailed setup and usage instructions.
compose:
mealie:
    image: hkotel/mealie:latest
    container_name: mealie
    ports:
      - "9925:80"
    environment:
      - DB_ENGINE=sqlite
      - DB_HOST=db
      - DB_PORT=5432
      - DB_USER=user
      - DB_PASSWORD=pass
      - DB_NAME=mealie
    volumes:
      - ${DATA_ROOT}/mealie/data:/app/data
      - ${DATA_ROOT}/mealie/config:/app/config
    restart: unless-stopped
name: mealie

homepage:
nextcloud:
  type: application
  name: Nextcloud VM
  category: My Apps
  url: https://github.com/nextcloud/vm
  api: nextcloud
docs:
## About
The Nextcloud VM (Virtual Machine) is designed to simplify the installation and management of a Nextcloud Server. It provides a guided installation process to set up a secure Nextcloud instance with optional curated apps.

![Nextcloud](https://github.com/nextcloud/nextcloud.com/blob/master/assets/img/features/VMwelcome.png)
![AdminNeo](https://i.imgur.com/tiF4chg.png)
![Webmin](https://i.imgur.com/hLkmA1D.png)
![TLS rating](https://i.imgur.com/nBEvczb.png)

## Prerequisites
- Ubuntu Server 24.04 LTS (minimal) 64-bit
- Linux Kernel 6.8
- Apache 2.4
- PostgreSQL 16
- PHP-FPM 8.3
- Redis Memcache
- PHP-igbinary
- PHP-smbclient
- Nextcloud Server Latest

## Installation
1. Download the Nextcloud VM from the [official website](https://download.nextcloud.com/vm/Official-Nextcloud-VM.zip).
2. Follow the interactive guidance provided by the VM scripts to complete the installation.

## Configuration
- Use the Nextcloud app store to extend core features with additional apps.
- For beta or RC versions, use the command `sudo bash /var/scripts/update.sh beta` or specify a version like `sudo bash /var/scripts/update.sh 23.0.1rc2`.

## Tips
- Ensure regular backups of your Nextcloud data.
- Use the curated apps for enhanced functionality and management.
- Monitor system updates and apply them to keep your instance secure.
compose:
nextcloud:
    image: nextcloud
    ports:
      - "8080:80"
    volumes:
      - ${DATA_ROOT}/nextcloud:/var/www/html
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=nextcloud
      - POSTGRES_USER=nextcloud
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=example
      - NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_USER=admin
      - NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD=admin
name: vm
